boat.name: Linnaea
boat.full_description: Linnea has white mainsail and stays'l with tan jib. The hull is painted green and the topsides varnished. She draws 2ft with the plate up; 4ft with it down. She has a Stuart Turner 2-stroke petrol auxiliary engine. Purchasde by her current owner bought her from Stuart & Graham Bernthal in 1981/82, she has been extensively rebuilt since then. She has two bunks on each side of the centerplate case, table, fair size galley and a little solid fuel stove.
boat.construction_details: Clinker pine on oak with iroko cockpit and cabin sides
boat.short_description: A 20ft Dauntless, Linnaea is of clinker construction, cutter rigged with high peaked gaff. She has in the past joined in most gaffers events on the East Coast and in 1993 she sailed through Holland to the Frisian Islands.
